Shantiniketan Indian School was founded on 27th July 2000 in
Doha Qatar by a team of promoters who felt the need to establish a school to provide quality education at affordable fees. Classes from Play School to Standard 6 began on 4th September 2000 at the B-Ring Road Campus. On 1st April 2003 Std. 9 was added and in April 2004 Std. 10 began. The new managing committee has plans to add +1 and +2 shortly
The schools is affiliated to CBSE and is approved by the Ministry of Education ,Doha Qatar Currently their are about 6000 students in classes KG - X and the school runs in 2 premises, ome in Musheirb ( classes II - X ) and the other in Doha Jadeed ( Playschool - standard I )
Objectives
To inculcate an integral view of life based on norms and values
To create an atmosphere of all round development of a student's personality
To provide education in the light of CBSE guidelines
To make the students aware of the global realities and to create a sense of responsibility and accountability among them
To develop a character of mutual cooperation, mutual tolerance, mutual respect and farsightedness in such a manner that they would become the responsible citizens of the future world
Planning
To achieve its objectives, the school takes the following measures :
Developing a classroom environment to facilitate communicative teaching and learning process
Adopting the approach to give individual attention for redressal of student's grievances
Implementing appropriate teaching methodology to upgrade student's standard of knowledge
Arranging co-curricular activities for multi dimensional personality development
Periodic assessment of the students to apply remedial measures
Identifying the reasons of poor performance of the students and arranging academic support for the needy
Establishing a parent's forum to solicit their suggestions
Organising subject clubs to stimulate intellectual curiosity, clear thinking and accurate perception of the subject
Arranging the workshop for the staff to equip them with latest teaching methodology
Regular parent teacher interaction
Developing Prefect System in school buses to have a closer touch with transport grievances
The Faculty
